page.title: 19ST.JOHN SOUTHWORTH 1592-1654
page.content: John was ordained in France and then spent most of his working life amongst the poor families in plague-stricken London. He served several prison sentences because he was an R.C. priest and was finally arrested in 1654. At his trial he pleaded not guilty to treason, but confessed priesthood.The judges found him guilty, but did their best to save his life, trying in vain for many hours to persuade him to change his plea. Reluctantly they were compelled to condemn him to death.John thanked the Court for their exceptional and admirable kindness and the magi- trate was so upset that he had difficulty pronouncing the sentence His execution was dramatic, taking place in a violent thunderstorm.He was the last priest to be martyred in Eng- and and his body is now in Westminster Cathedral. He was canonized in 1970.
